item.title: Donate
item.description: Since Vertcoin did not have an ICO (Initial Coin Offering) or pre-mine (allocation of currency at the launch of the network), the development team relies on community donations for their funding. Whilst the developers work as volunteers and do not get paid a salary, they do make costs to advance the project. On this page, we have detailed a number of donation goals that require additional funds. You may select the goal that mosts suits you; we pledge to use the funding on the designated goal and account for these in our monthly development update.

item.title: Bitcoin vs Vertcoin
item.description: Vertcoin had its first block back in Jan 2014. It was built using Bitcoin as a base. Credits to the Bitcoin Core developers who develop the Bitcoin Core software. Vertcoin was created as a GPU mined version of Bitcoin. This enables greater spread of security long term compared to ASICs. If enough devices mine the network, Vertcoin represents a viable alternative to the Bitcoin ASIC mined security model. Ethereum currently uses a mining algorithm similar to the proposed Verthash mining algorithm and achieves security near that of Bitcoin, which means the task is achieveable.

item.title: Specifications
item.description: .content-container { display: flex; justify-content: space-between; max-width: 1124px; } img { max-width: 53px; } Built on Bitcoin, receiving any future Bitcoin updates upon specification release confirmation. Vertcoin was the first coin to lock in and activate SegWit. It was activated May 7, 2017 Has the same block time (2.5 mins) as Litecoin and same supply of coins (84,000,000 coins). These changes are well within scaling limits of blockchain growth and orphan generation (1:30) Mining algorithm proposed is similar to Ethereum's Ethash (Verthash), meaning GPUs mine competitively.
